facts.text: The Great Wall of China is the longest wall in the world, stretching over 13,000 miles.
facts.title: Great Wall of China

facts.text: The movie 'The Shawshank Redemption' is often regarded as one of the greatest films of all time.
facts.title: The Shawshank Redemption

facts.text: The first programmable computer, the Z3, was created by Konrad Zuse in 1941.
facts.title: Z3 Computer

facts.text: Leonardo da Vinci's 'Mona Lisa' is one of the most famous paintings in the world.
facts.title: Mona Lisa

facts.text: Usain Bolt holds the world record for the fastest 100m and 200m sprints.
facts.title: Usain Bolt's Records

facts.text: Coco Chanel revolutionized fashion with the 'Little Black Dress' and the Chanel suit.
facts.title: Coco Chanel's Fashion

facts.text: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and remains the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different scientific fields.
facts.title: Marie Curie

facts.text: The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world, covering most of North Africa.
facts.title: Sahara Desert

facts.text: The construction of the Eiffel Tower was completed in 1889 and it was the tallest man-made structure in the world at the time.
facts.title: Eiffel Tower

facts.text: The film 'Star Wars' was directed by George Lucas and first released in 1977.
facts.title: Star Wars

facts.text: The World Wide Web was created by Tim Berners-Lee in 1989, revolutionizing the internet.
facts.title: World Wide Web

facts.text: Vincent van Gogh's 'Starry Night' is considered one of the most iconic paintings in art history.
facts.title: Starry Night

facts.text: The Olympics, with their origins in ancient Greece, have been held for over 2,700 years.
facts.title: Olympic Games

facts.text: The little black dress (LBD) became a fashion staple after being popularized by Coco Chanel.
facts.title: Little Black Dress

facts.text: Albert Einstein's theory of relativity transformed our understanding of space and time.
facts.title: Albert Einstein

facts.text: The Amazon Rainforest is the largest tropical rainforest in the world, spanning several countries in South America.
facts.title: Amazon Rainforest

facts.text: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to the United States and was dedicated in 1886.
facts.title: Statue of Liberty

facts.text: The first 'Jurassic Park' film, directed by Steven Spielberg, was released in 1993 and became a blockbuster hit.
facts.title: Jurassic Park

facts.text: The invention of the light bulb is often attributed to Thomas Edison, who patented it in 1879.
facts.title: Light Bulb Invention

facts.text: The 'Mona Lisa' is housed in the Louvre Museum in Paris, France, and is one of the museum's most famous artworks.
facts.title: Mona Lisa at the Louvre
